name: Holiday Inn Philadelphia Stadium

reviews.text: I checked into this hotel and I thought I was back in the 80's. The carpet was nasty and the a/c was very musty (4th floor). I did get moved up to the 8th floor and this room was a little better. Make sure you get a room with 'blue' carpet, not 'green'.
reviews.title: In need of a remodel.

reviews.text: This hotel is 10 min. away from the airport and not near any other hotels or places to eat. It might work well if you are attending a baseball game or concert, but it does not work well for business travelers.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: Several people I was with stayed at the Sheraton Suites next to the airport and this was much better.
reviews.title: Disappointing.

likes.disliked: — Hotel is in need of renovation.

reviews.text: Bathrooms were dirty. Shower had mold on the tiles and all the plumbing fixtures were loose.
reviews.title: Close to Stadium

reviews.text: The hotel room carpet was dirty and sticky.
reviews.title: Loved the Holiday Inn Philadelphia Stadium

reviews.text: Ok, so I reserved a room in March of 2008 for a one night stay for my husband, daughter and I for June 5th, 08. We were in town to see Tom Petty and wanted to stay someplace close so we wouldn''t have to fight traffic.
reviews.title: Absolutely HORRIBLE!! Believe the other REVIEWS!
HORRIBLE!!!
reviews.text: One month before our visit, we found out that our credit card was charged for the room in advance. After talking to the Manager twice who refused to discuss this error with me as I reserved in my husbands name, I asked my husband to call the Manager and resolve and after 4 messages to this man my husband finally gave up. No calls were ever returned, however our bank did file a complaint with the hotel and had our money put back on our card. This should have told us something...

Well, the location was perfect, but when we arrived 2 hours early for check-in they could not give me what I had reserved! I reserved 2 double beds/smoking. First I was told they only have 4 smoking rooms and they had been taken. "First come first serve" policy. I asked just how early you need to check in as I was 2 hours early and I never got a reply to that question. Next, they said they were out of double beds but they would give me a queen and a roll away. I told them that was unacceptable. I reserved 2 double beds for a reason. I was not putting my daughter on a roll away for the amount of money I was paying nor was she sleeping with her father and I!! After causing quite a fuss, another woman came out from behind the desk and moved another guest that was flying into town into the queen room and gave us the double. I felt sorry for thos folks..
reviews.title: Great location!!!
Disliked the Service
reviews.text: The room itself definitely needed work. The bathroom was small and mildew in the shower.
The carpet really needs to be replaced!
reviews.title: Ignorant Manager & Staff!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyone who simply wants a place to sleep, LOOK SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!! The hotel staff was more than rude, i would even say insulting. Very unhelpful!!!! After calling the morning before arrival, they had cancelled our reservation because the orbitz card declined. After speaking with Orbitz, "the hotel is not supposed to charge the card until after check-out because the account is not opened until check-in". They told us the hotel knew this and shoudl reinstate our reservation. After speaking between orbitz and the hotel for 2 HOURS (mind you we had a six hour drive to get there, and had a 6:30 game to catch), they gave us a new reservation number and said we were set. We get there with only an hour to spare because of the hold up in the morning, and the night staff that is now on has no idea what we are talking about. We give them the names of the managers we had spoken to and told them to call them, they wouldn't!!!! They told us to call orbitz back. Orbitz RE-SENT the fax they sent that morning so we could get into the room. Once getting into the room, it smelled, bed was terribly uncofortable, air conditioner was loud and sounded broken, room service wouldn't bring us a fork. The room and the hotel were a must NEVER SEE!!!! after returning home and trying to find answers, we were sent in circles between the hotel and the corporate headquarters; the end result being NOTHING!!! NOT EVEN A SINCERE APOLOGY!!!! be warned, this place is AWFUL!!! although close to the park, i would have rather stayed an hour away and drove the extra...especially seeing as the hotel for one night cost $195.00. We still have not heard back from the managers and it has now been three days...if your looking for even minimally good service, you WILL NOT FIND IT HERE!!!
reviews.title: This Place Is a Joke!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First and foremost, the desk staffer during check-in was very helpful and pleasant. We arrived to find our booking thru Hotwire cancelled with confusion about why. I had to call Hotwire who informed me to rebook or go to another hotel and they would reimburse. We were without transportation and since lobby was clean, attractive and updated, we decided it was easiest to stay. Manager refused to allow us to rebook at previous rate through hotwire, so we paid $159 for a room that left much to be desired. Carpeting was damp and sticky feeling and doors to room have about a 2 inch gap underneath allowing lots of light and plenty of noise throughout the night. It looks like old carpeting was replaced that must have been more plush than new. Between the ice machine down the hall and elevators dinging, I got very little sleep. Bathroom looks like partially redone but lots of mildew and a ceiling poorly done with holes in corners. Bed and bedding could use update! Not very comfortable. Thankfully it was only 1 night! Shuttle service to airport was timely and driver was friendly and helpful. Prior to our stay here, we spent 3 nights at a Sheraton in Center City Philly that was far superior AND WE PAID MUCH LESS! The stadiums are right there and we had a great view. It is very convenient for a game. I would not recommend to my friends. This is the type of place I imagine my college age son and his friends hanging out in.
reviews.title: Rooms could use complete make over

reviews.text: I had called in the day I was arriving to let the hotel know that it would be a very late arrival. I reached the reception and the lady there was helpfull but not really bothered other than give me my room card, because it looked like I had interrupted her flirting with a guy she was talking to on the side. It was very obvious, not professional at all. I go to my room, everything on the periphery looked clean but look in the tub, you will see mold on the tiles and the sides of the tub. I crashed in to sleep. Woke up early to check my email. I cannot connect to the "free wireless internet" because apparently the "signal is poor" on the 8th floor. I went to the lobby and the lobby was filled with prospective interviewees for some job in the hotel. There were no empty chairs. So when I find a chair in the corner to sit and I am told by the manager: "Sir, can you find some other place, because I am conducting an interview here". Customer first policy, to the core!!! By the way, the whole lobby was the hang out of business travellers on every floor of the hotel, not just the higher floors, because no one had access to the wireless internet in their rooms. I was in for another surprise the second night, there was no parking available easily accessible, apparently they let people coming for the Phillies match to valet park in their lot. The service in the restaurant within the hotel, is just below normal standards. If you are looking for a place to sleep in the night, then this hotel is fine. But if you want some of the benefits that a business traveller is used to, then please look some where else.
reviews.title: Stay away. Had to review this one!!!

likes.liked: — I can not think of anything memorable.
likes.disliked: — Free Wireless Internet, signal was non existent on every floor but lobby.

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights on a business trip. The only thing going for this Holiday Inn is the location right next to the stadiums. We called for a courtesy van from the airport, and after 40 minutes, nothing showed up. After we called back, we found out the manager cancelled our pickup, since our bookings were done via our corporate travel department. It was a $20 taxi ride from the airport to the hotel, and after we found the manager, he stuck to his belief that if someone books their reservations via any other site than Holiday Inn, they will not provide courtesy transportation from the airport to the hotel.
reviews.title: Location is the only thing for this place!

reviews.text: This hotel is dated, the staff at the check in desk seem to have a low morale, and it takes forever for the air conditioner to cool the room.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.liked: — Nice size room with auto climate control
likes.disliked: — Noisy church kids, but they quieted down.

reviews.text: Have stayed at this Holiday Inn several times, in fact, will be going back this weekend for a Nets/Sixers game. CAVEAT: The ONLY reason is because of its proximity to the sports complex. I park my car at the hotel, and can walk to any of the venues easily. The rooms need updating, and are only so-so for cleanliness. One elevator is frequently down for repairs, meaning a long wait. The staff does their job, and that's about it. Not helpful in anything that requires any customer service. We were there for a Mets/Phillies game. Some drunk set off the fire alarm. It continued ringing for 45 minutes, even after the fire dept cleared the place... seems the only guy in the hotel who knows how to reset it was out of reach. JEEZ! AGAIN, GREAT FOR BALLGAMES, but little else.
reviews.title: best spot for a ballgame, but little else

reviews.text: I had been uneasy at first staying at this hotel, since I booked through Hotwire (non-refundable) and didn't find out the name of the hotel until I paid my deposit. There had been a number of negative reviews, but I was pleasantly surprised by my stay:
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: The Holiday Inn Stadium in Philadelphia is very conveniently located. Our room had been newly renovated. The work had been done very well, except for the sheetrock on the bathroom ceiling which, unfortunately, had not been finished along the edges, so that water had gotten into it. Other than that, it was a very pleasant stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. I got a good rate of $79/night from Hotwire. According to Holiday Inn's site, the room would have retailed for over $250/night. I can't say that I would have paid that.
reviews.title: Terrible Experience

reviews.text: Bad experice. Spent $200 per night, out of date room, extremely bad internet (when traveling on business, I expect good internet to do work in my room,) I couldn't even connect. A co worker on a different floor had the same problem. Corporate did compensate me. Also took a bit of time to check in (was getting ignored by staff, I had to be rude to get service.)
reviews.title: Give it a chance

likes.disliked: — Rooms can use a little updating

aka: Holiday Inn Philadelphia Stadium Hotel Philadelphia
description: Minutes from the city, steps to entertainment. Welcome to the Holiday Inn Hotel Philadelphia Stadium. Located in South Philadelphia and only steps from the Sports Complex and Naval Yard. The hotel is perfectly located between downtown Philadelphia and the Philadelphia Airport. The 238 guest rooms are over-sized rooms, featuring free high speed wireless Internet access and free HBO. We handle catering groups, corporate groups and leisure travelers. Relax by the outdoor swimming pool or just enjoy a drink or some food at Stadium Sports Bar & Restaurant. Specializing in weddings, banquets, meetings or any special events, the Holiday Inn Philadelphia Stadium offers 15,000 square feet of meeting and banquet space to accommodate up to 600 people. So if you are looking to attend a sports game, concert or any other event at one of the Philadelphia sports venues - Citizens Bank Ballpark, Lincoln Financial Field, the Comcast Spectator or Wells Fargo Center- then the Holiday Inn Philadelphia Stadium is the place to spend the night! But do not forget that the Holiday Inn Philadelphia Stadium is also very conveniently located to local museums, King of Prussia Mall, Philadelphia International Airport, historic Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Convention center, Tweeter Center, Sugar House Casino, Atlantic City, Xfinity Live!, Campbell s Field and the New Jersey State Aquarium. Or how about making a stop in Atlantic City or Lancaster? We are everything you expect and so much more!
